DataElement.preferredName: Schedule Study Activity Ideal Date and Time Range ISO21090.IVL.TS.DATETIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date and time span specifying when the activity was originally scheduled to begin and end. NOTE(S): This would be the date and time span based on applying the study calendar to a specific subject.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Schedule Study Activity Ideal Date and Time Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._Conforming to an ultimate standard of perfection or excellence.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

Concepts.definition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Conforming to an ultimate standard of perfection or excellence.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

Concepts.definition: Conforming to an ultimate standard of perfection or excellence.
An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval. mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Set of consecutive values of an ordered base datatype of the type TS.DATETIME.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
